sec.title: Elevating operator station
sec.p: In addition to the provisions for operator cabs and operator canopies, the following applies to elevating operator stations.

list-item.label: a)
list-item.p: The lift and descent speed of the operator’s station shall not exceed 0,6 m/s under normal operating conditions or 0,4 m/s in case of hydraulic line rupture. The operator's station shall not exceed ±15° on horizontal tilting.

list-item.label: b)
list-item.p: If service or maintenance work has to be done with a raised station, a mechanical support device shall be provided. The device shall meet the performance requirements of ISO 13333:1994, Clause 4.

list-item.label: c)
list-item.p: The elevating control shall be clearly marked and protected against unintentional activation.

list-item.label: d)
list-item.p: In case of failure of the source of energy, engine stop or hydraulic system failure, it shall be possible for the operator to lower the station to the lowest position (irrespective of the actual position) or to leave the station safely, e.g. by steps or stairs.

list-item.label: e)
list-item.p: Access shall be in accordance with ISO 2867.

list-item.label: f)
list-item.p: Load holding cylinders in accordance with 4.13.2 shall be provided to prevent the station from falling. As an alternative, a loader lowering control device in accordance with ISO 8643 may be used.
